alert.note: Alert for Russell (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 5:21PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Russell County through 600 PM CDT... At 521 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Uchee to 6 miles west of Seale to near Hurtsboro. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hurtsboro, Russell County Sports Complex, Uchee, Seale, Rutherford, Hatchechubbe, Uchee Creek, Fort Mitchell, Fort Mitchell Activity Center and Parkmanville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
